value.description: Field names (in order) to read from the source table. ie. the select fields. The format is separated by newline. Inconsistent order will cause corruption of the downstream Hive data.

value.name: Max Wait Time

referencingComponents.name: Query Hive Table Metadata

entry.value: SELECT d.NAME DATABASE_NAME, d.OWNER_NAME OWNER, t.CREATE_TIME, t.TBL_NAME, t.TBL_TYPE, c.COLUMN_NAME, c.TYPE_NAME FROM hive.COLUMNS_V2 c JOIN hive.TBLS t ON c.CD_ID=t.TBL_ID JOIN hive.DBS d on d.DB_ID = t.DB_ID where d.name = '${source}'and t.tbl_name like '${entity}%';

relationships.description: Successfully created FlowFile from .
relationships.name: success

value.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).
value.name: JSON container options

value.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'
value.name: Wrap Single Record

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or cannot be converted to JSON for any reason
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been converted to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The parent HDFS directory to which files should be written
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: Size of each block as written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Block Size

value.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: IO Buffer Size

value.description: Number of times that HDFS will replicate each file. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Replication

value.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode
value.name: Permissions umask

value.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner
value.name: Remote Owner

value.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group
value.name: Remote Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to HDFS for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to HDFS are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: Generates 'bins' of FlowFiles and fills each bin as full as possible. FlowFiles are placed into a bin based on their size and optionally their attributes (if the <Correlation Attribute> property is set)

Combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. If using this strategy, all FlowFiles must have the attributes <fragment.identifier>, <fragment.count>, and <fragment.index> or alternatively (for backward compatibility purposes) <segment.identifier>, <segment.count>, and <segment.index>. All FlowFiles with the same value for "fragment.identifier" will be grouped together. All FlowFiles in this group must have the same value for the "fragment.count" attribute. All FlowFiles in this group must have a unique value for the "fragment.index" attribute between 0 and the value of the "fragment.count" attribute.

value.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge content. The 'Defragment' algorithm combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. The 'Bin-Packing Algorithm' generates a FlowFile populated by arbitrarily chosen FlowFiles
value.name: Merge Strategy

allowableValues.description: A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single TAR file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the TAR file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the TAR file. If a FlowFile has an attribute named <tar.permissions> that is 3 characters, each between 0-7, that attribute will be used as the TAR entry's 'mode'.

A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single ZIP file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the ZIP file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the ZIP file. The <Compression Level> property indicates the ZIP compression to use.
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 3 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 2 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 1 FlowFile Package
The contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile
The Avro contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile

value.description: Determines the format that will be used to merge the content.
value.name: Merge Format

value.description: Determines which FlowFile attributes should be added to the bundle. If 'Keep All Unique Attributes' is selected, any attribute on any FlowFile that gets bundled will be kept unless its value conflicts with the value from another FlowFile. If 'Keep Only Common Attributes' is selected, only the attributes that exist on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved.
value.name: Attribute Strategy

value.description: If specified, like FlowFiles will be binned together, where 'like FlowFiles' means FlowFiles that have the same value for this Attribute. If not specified, FlowFiles are bundled by the order in which they are pulled from the queue.
value.name: Correlation Attribute Name

value.description: The minimum number of files to include in a bundle
value.name: Minimum Number of Entries

value.description: The maximum number of files to include in a bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Number of Entries

value.description: The minimum size of for the bundle
value.name: Minimum Group Size

value.description: The maximum size for the bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Group Size

value.description: The maximum age of a Bin that will trigger a Bin to be complete. Expected format is <duration> <time unit> where <duration> is a positive integer and time unit is one of seconds, minutes, hours
value.name: Max Bin Age

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of bins that can be held in memory at any one time
value.name: Maximum number of Bins

allowableValues.description: The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be retrieved from the contents of a file
The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be specified as property values

value.description: Determines if Header, Footer, and Demarcator should point to files containing the respective content, or if the values of the properties should be used as the content.
value.name: Delimiter Strategy

value.description: Filename specifying the header to use. If not specified, no header is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Header File

value.description: Filename specifying the footer to use. If not specified, no footer is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Footer File

value.description: Filename specifying the demarcator to use. If not specified, no demarcator is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Demarcator File

value.description: Specifies the compression level to use when using the Zip Merge Format; if not using the Zip Merge Format, this value is ignored
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If using the Zip or Tar Merge Format, specifies whether or not the FlowFiles' paths should be included in their entry names; if using other merge strategy, this value is ignored
value.name: Keep Path

relationships.description: If the bundle cannot be created, all FlowFiles that would have been used to created the bundle will be transferred to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The FlowFile containing the merged content
relationships.name: merged

relationships.description: The FlowFiles that were used to create the bundle
relationships.name: original

value.description: The database where the source table resides
value.name: Source Database Connection

value.description: The Think Big metadata service
value.name: Metadata Service

value.description: System category of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed category

value.description: Name of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed name

value.description: Name of table including schema (if applicable)
value.name: Source Table

value.description: Field names (in order) to read from the source table. ie. the select fields. The format is separated by newline. Inconsistent order will cause corruption of the downstream Hive data.
value.name: Source Fields

value.description: Whether to load the entire table or perform an incremental extract
value.name: Load Strategy

value.description: Fieldname of the source field containing the modified date for incremental load
value.name: Date Field

value.description: Amount of time to overlap into the last load date to ensure long running transactions missed by previous load weren't missed. Recommended: >60s
value.name: Overlap Period

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

relationships.description: Table extract execution failed. Incoming FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successful but no new data to process.
relationships.name: nodata

relationships.description: Successful created new flow file from the table.
relationships.name: success

value.description: Specified Service supplying the implemtentions of the various metadata providers
value.name: Metadata Provider Service

value.description: Service that manages preconditions that trigger feed execution
value.name: Feed Precondition Event Service

value.description: The unique name of the feed that is beginning
value.name: feed.id

value.description: The name of the datasource that this feed will read from (optional)
value.name: src.dataset.id

relationships.description: Relationship followed on failed metadata capture.
relationships.name: Failure

relationships.description: Relationship followed on successful metadata capture.
relationships.name: Success

value.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).
value.name: JSON container options

value.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'
value.name: Wrap Single Record

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or cannot be converted to JSON for any reason
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been converted to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The full HDFS directory(s) to create separated by newline
value.name: Directory

value.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode
value.name: Permissions umask

value.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner
value.name: Remote Owner

value.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group
value.name: Remote Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to HDFS for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to HDFS are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The parent HDFS directory to which files should be written
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: Size of each block as written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Block Size

value.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: IO Buffer Size

value.description: Number of times that HDFS will replicate each file. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Replication

value.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode
value.name: Permissions umask

value.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner
value.name: Remote Owner

value.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group
value.name: Remote Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to HDFS for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to HDFS are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Specified Service supplying the implemtentions of the various metadata providers
value.name: Metadata Provider Service

value.description: The unique name of the destinationDatasource that the feed will update
value.name: dest.dataset.id

value.description: The completion result of the feed
value.displayName: Completion result of this feed terminating processor
value.name: completion_result

value.description: The name of the database containing the table where the feed writes its processing results
value.name: database.name

value.description: The name of the table where the feed writes its processing results
value.name: table.name

value.description: The URI specifying the location where the feed writes its processing results
value.name: table.location

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Think Big metadata service
value.name: Metadata Service

value.description: System category of feed this processor supports
value.name: System Feed Category

value.description: System name of feed this processor supports
value.name: System Feed Name

relationships.description: Registration is required.
relationships.name: registration_required

relationships.description: Registration already occurred or not required.
relationships.name: success

value.description: The name of the index
value.name: IndexName

value.description: Elasticsearch type
value.name: Type

value.description: Elasticsearch host
value.name: HostName

value.description: Elasticsearch cluster
value.name: ClusterName

value.description: Id that you want to use for indexing into elasticsearch. If it is empty then a uuid will be generated
value.name: IdField

relationships.description: Json objects that are un-successfully indexed in elasticsearch are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Json objects that are successfully indexed in elasticsearch are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The name of the hive database field
value.name: Database Name Field

value.description: Database owner field name
value.name: Database Owner Field

value.description: Field representing the table create time
value.name: Table Create Time Field

value.description: Field holding the table name
value.name: Table Name Field

value.description: Field representing what type of hive table it is
value.name: Table Type Field

value.description: Field representing the column name
value.name: Column Name Field

value.description: Field representing what the column type is
value.name: Column Type Field

relationships.description: Json objects that are un-successfully merged are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Json objects that are successfully merged are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

entry.value: registration_dttm|timestamp id|bigint first_name|string last_name|string email|string gender|string ip_address|string cc|string country|string birthdate|string salary|decimal(8,2) title|string comments|string
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' LINES TERMINATED BY '\n' STORED AS TEXTFILE

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.name: completion_result

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to 'match' if one or all Expressions match, depending on the configuration of the Routing Strategy property
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

value.description: SQL select query
value.name: SQL select query

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

entry.value: SELECT d.NAME DATABASE_NAME, d.OWNER_NAME OWNER, t.CREATE_TIME, t.TBL_NAME, t.TBL_TYPE, c.COLUMN_NAME, c.TYPE_NAME FROM hive.COLUMNS_V2 c JOIN hive.TBLS t ON c.CD_ID=t.TBL_ID JOIN hive.DBS d on d.DB_ID = t.DB_ID where d.name = '${source}'and t.tbl_name like '${entity}%';

relationships.description: SQL query execution failed. Incoming FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successfully created FlowFile from SQL query result set.
relationships.name: success
